htw.vs1.filesystem.FileSystem.physical

Class PhysicalFileSystemAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • htw.vs1.filesystem.FileSystem.physical.PhysicalFileSystemAdapter

  • public class PhysicalFileSystemAdapter
extends java.lang.Object

    Adapter to connect a folder of the file system of the local machine with our virtual file system.

    The root LocalFolder is the base folder of the folder ot the file system of the local machine this program is running on.

    Created by Felix on 09.06.2015.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static PhysicalFileSystemAdapter getInstance()
      Gets the single instance of the PhysicalFileSystemAdapter.
      protected void loadFileSystemDirectories(java.nio.file.Path directory, LocalFolder parentFolder)
      Iterates over a given directory and adds all its objects to our virtual file system.
      java.lang.String loadFileSystemTree()
      Iterates recursively over the directory with the path given in the constructor and puts each folder and file into the root folder of our virtual file system.
      protected void registerDirectoryToWatchService(java.nio.file.Path dir)
      Adds a directory identified by its Path to the watch service.
      void startWatchService()
      Starts the watch service which observes the physical file system for changes.
      void stopWatchService()
      Stops the watch service.

                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Iterates recursively over the directory with the path given in the constructor and puts each folder and file into the root folder of our virtual file system.
        Returns:
        absolute path of the loaded file system tree.

        java.io.IOException
